p: A total of 62 plants reputed as antiparasitic in traditional medicine in Sudan were solicited from the repository of theÂ Faculty of Pharmacy, University of Science & Technology. The plants belonged to 35 different families, of which the Combretaceae, Leguminosae, Verbenaceae, Lamiaceae, and Compositae were the most frequent. Where available, different parts of a given plant species were included in the study.
